Question: You may use a right turn bay to overtake a vehicle travelling straight ahead.
As the holder of any class of driver licence you must carry your licence with you at all times when driving.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you have a rear tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: When turning right from a two-laned road into a one-way street that has two lanes, which lane must you turn into?

Answers.Answer: The lane that has the least vehicles
The lane that gives you the most direct route

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do before turning left into a driveway?

Answers.Answer: Check the driveway is clear and enter
Signal only if there is a vehicle behind you and enter
Signal for 3 seconds or more and if the driveway is clear, enter
Signal only if another vehicle is coming towards you and enter

Question: What should you do when following another vehicle in wet conditions?

Answers.Answer: Drive closer to the vehicle so that you can follow in its tracks
Drive with your vehicle handbrake on

Question: If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?
If you are driving and you want to use a cellphone what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Stop in the flush median to answer calls when it is safe to do so
Answer the call at the next set of traffic signals
Slow down to answer the call when it is safe to do so
Pull over and stop to use the cellphone when it is safe to do so

Question: A police officer has the power to arrest you for:

Answers.Answer: failing to supply your correct name and address
having no warrant of fitness for your vehicle
failing to signal a right turn
failing to stop at a stop sign

Question: For the purpose of applying the give way rule, entrance ways into public car parks should be treated as:
When you have a learner licence you do not have to have it with you when you drive if your supervisor has their licence with them.
If you miss your exit on a motorway, you should:

Answers.Answer: use the flush median strip and reverse back to the exit
make a U-turn back to the exit
drive on to the next exit
slowly stop and reverse back to the exit

Question: If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left

Question: On a Transit Lane sign, what does T2 mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles that use the lane must have at least two people.
Vehicles that use the lane must have two passengers
Only two vehicles are permitted on the transit lane at any time
There are two transit lanes ahead

Question: What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: Which one of the following vehicles can you drive on a car licence?
When coming up to a one-lane bridge, what does this sign indicate?

Answers.Answer: Others should give way to you

Question: Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you are the driver and hurt somebody in a crash, who must you report it to?
What does the legal definition of a road include?
What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may stop your vehicle if there are no buses coming
You may stop your vehicle between 6pm and 8am except on Fridays and Saturdays
You may stop your vehicle if someone stays with it
You may not stop your vehicle at any time

Question: At night, you MUST always dip the headlights on your vehicle when:
What should you do if you are driving and become sleepy?

Answers.Answer: Drive on the far left side of the road
Move off to the left of the road and have a rest
Speed up so that you can get home quickly
Keep on driving but use a lower gear

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There is loose gravel on the road that could break your windscreen
There is broken glass on the road
